thread.title: Hedge Funds Turn Bullish on Treasuries as Yield Hovers Near 2%
thread.title_full: Hedge Funds Turn Bullish on Treasuries as Yield Hovers Near 2% - Bloomberg Business

author: Kevin Buckland
title: Hedge Funds Turn Bullish on Treasuries as Yield Hovers Near 2%
text:
Investors have swung back to bets that Treasuries will strengthen, as the yield on benchmark 10-year notes hovers near 2 percent.
Hedge funds and other large speculators held a net 17,692 bullish positions in U.S. government bonds in the week to Oct. 13, from 2,543 net bearish contracts in the previous period. Ten-year Treasury yields fell to 1.97 percent on Oct. 14, the lowest close since April 27, as bets receded for the first Federal Reserve interest-rate increase since 2006 this year.
“It’s mainly the Fed, and not really knowing when they’re going to start tightening” that is keeping yields suppressed, said Janu Chan, an economist at St. George Bank Ltd. in Sydney. “Low inflation is allowing the Fed time to delay, and it also increases the chances that they’ll really go gradually.”
The yield on the 10-year note fell one basis point to 2.02 percent as of 9:33 a.m. in Tokyo, after dropping five basis points last week, according to Bloomberg Bond Trader data. The 2 percent note maturing in August 2025 rose 1/8, or $1.25 per $1,000 face amount, to 99 26/32.
